devices.title: Device names
devices.description: List of smart home device names to add as HomeKit accessories. If no devices are specified, the plugin will attempt to add all supported accessories.

amazonDomain.title: Amazon domain
amazonDomain.description: The Amazon domain that your devices are registered to.

language.title: Two character language code hyphen two character country code

refreshInterval.title: Refresh interval
refreshInterval.placeholder: Refresh the session automatically every __ days
refreshInterval.description: How often this plugin should automatically refresh the session with Amazon. Defaults to every 4 days.

clientHost.title: Proxy Client Host
clientHost.description: A current IP address or hostname of the Homebridge host that is accessible from the web browser where you will authenticate from.

port.title: Proxy port
port.description: The port to run the authentication proxy on.

cacheTTL.title: Device state cache lifetime
cacheTTL.description: Refresh Alexa device states every __ seconds. Higher values will allow this plugin to work faster if you are noticing 'This plugin slows down Homebridge' messages in the Homebridge logs. However, higher values also means device states may be less accurate.

backgroundRefresh.title: Refresh device states automatically in the background.
backgroundRefresh.description: By default, device states are only updated when requested. For example, when the Home app is opened. If you notice 'This plugin slows down Homebridge' messages in the Homebridge logs, it is recommended to enable background refresh and set the 'Device state cache lifetime' to a value of 300 or more.

debug.title: Debug logging
debug.description: Whether to enable debug logging for troubleshooting issues and support.
